title: Savory Oatmeal with Parmesan & Fried Egg
description: A creamy, umami-forward savory oatmeal finished with nutty grated Parmesan, a runny fried egg, and bright herb oil. Quick to make, it balances soft steel-cut oats with salty cheese, butter, and crisped egg edges for a comforting breakfast or light lunch.

steps.text: Bring the stock, water, and parmesan rind to a gentle simmer in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add the steel-cut oats and minced garlic to the simmering liquid, stir once, then reduce heat to low to maintain a gentle simmer.
Cook oats, stirring every 2–3 minutes to prevent sticking, until tender but still slightly toothsome and the mixture is creamy, about 18–20 minutes total.
While oats finish, heat a nonstick or well-seasoned skillet over medium-high heat and add olive oil; crack eggs into a small bowl and gently slide into skillet to fry.

Fry eggs until whites are set with slightly crisp edges and yolks reach desired doneness (about 2–3 minutes for runny yolk; cover pan for slightly set yolk). Season eggs with a pinch of salt and pepper.

When oats are done, remove and discard the parmesan rind, stir in butter and grated Parmesan until melted and combined. Adjust seasoning with salt, pepper, and optional red pepper flakes and lemon zest.

Make a quick herb oil by stirring sliced chives into remaining olive oil (or use warm oil) and spoon a little over each bowl. Divide oatmeal between bowls, top each with a fried egg, a grind of pepper, extra parmesan, and a drizzle of herb oil.
